newsitem.title: USA: Ohio 1,205 MW Perry nuke seen on line late Thur.
newsitem.headline: Ohio 1,205 MW Perry nuke seen on line late Thur.

text.p: The 1,205 megawatt Perry nuclear power plant in North Perry, Ohio, was expected to resume electricity production late Thursday following a repair shutdown, a spokesman for the plant's operator said.
"We expect it to be back on the grid by about 10 o'clock (2200 EST) tonight," Jim Sielicki, a spokesman for plant operator Centerior Energy Corp, said Thursday.
The plant was shut early Tuesday due to an electrical problem.
The Perry plant would likely boost electricity output to 100 percent of capacity over the weekend, Sielicki said.
Centerior is the majority owner of the plant. Ohio Edison Co and DQE Inc also have ownership interests in the plant.
